contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox broadcast | call_letters = Puebla TV<br/><small>XHPUE-TV</small> | station_logo = | location = [[Puebla, Puebla|Puebla]], [[Mexico]] | city = | station_branding = Puebla TV | station_slogan = | analog = Canal 26 ([[UHF]]) | digital = | subchannels = | other_chs = | affiliations = [[educational television|Independent educational]] | owner = Televisión Radio y Tecnologías Digitales | licensee = Estado de Puebla | founded = November 28, 2002 | airdate = | callsign_meaning = | sister_stations = | former_callsigns = | former_channel_numbers = | former_affiliations = | former_locations = | effective_radiated_power = 728 [[kilowatt|kW]] | HAAT = | class = | facility_id = | coordinates = | homepage = [http://www.puebla.mx/Puebla%20tv.html http://www.puebla.mx/tv] | telephone = }} {{Infobox broadcast | call_letters = XHPZL-TV | station_logo = | location = [[Zacatlan, Puebla]] | city = | station_branding = | station_slogan = | analog = 4 ([[VHF]]) | digital = | subchannels = | other_chs = | affiliations = | owner = | licensee = | founded = February 11, 1999 | airdate = | callsign_meaning = | sister_stations = | former_callsigns = | former_channel_numbers = | former_affiliations = | former_locations = | effective_radiated_power = 100 [[watt|watts]] | HAAT = | class = | facility_id = | coordinates = | homepage = | telephone = }} '''Puebla TV''' ('''XHPUE-TV''' channel 26 [[Puebla, Puebla|Puebla]] and channel 4 [[Zacatlán, Puebla|Zacatlán]]) is the regional [[public television]] network of the [[Mexican state]] of [[Puebla]]. Covering a little over 40% of the state (by population), it offers educational, cultural and alternative programming; much is locally generated content intended to address the needs, expectations and lives of Pueblan society.<ref>http://www.puebla.mx/Puebla%20tv.html</ref> In addition to its own productions, Puebla TV's broadcasts programming from [[Edusat (TV network)|Edusat]], [[Once TV]], the [[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] and other member broadcasters of the ''Red Nacional de Radiodifusoras y Televisoras Educativas y Culturales'' (National Network of Educational and Cultural Radio-Television Broadcasters). == References == {{reflist}} {{Mexican broadcast television}} [[Category:Public television in Mexico]] [[Category:Channel 26 TV stations in Mexico]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 2002]] [[Category:Media in Puebla, Puebla]] [[Category:2002 establishments in Mexico]]
